title: Protocol for efficient human MSC chondrogenesis via Wnt antagonism instead of TGF-β
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Pellet formation
Timing: 1 day
Formation of 3D MSC pellet at the bottom of tube by centrifugation and 16 h (overnight) culture.4[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib4],5[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib5],6[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib6]
Harvest MSCs from culture flasks by trypsinization and centrifuge the cells at 300 × g for 5 min.
Resuspend the cell pellet in complete culture medium at a concentration of 2×105 cells/mL.
Add 1 mL of cell suspension to 15 mL conical centrifuge tube.
Centrifuge the tubes at 450 × g for 10 min.
Slightly loosen the cap of centrifuge tube and incubate the tubes at 37°C in humidified incubator with 5% CO2 for 16 h (overnight).
Wnt antagonism-based chondrogenic induction
Timing: 1 day
Induce MSC chondrogenic differentiation by replacing the culture medium with Wnt antagonism-based chondrogenic medium.
Replace the complete culture medium with Wnt antagonism-based chondrogenic medium.
Carefully remove the liquid from the centrifuge tube and avoid aspirating the MSC pellet.
Slowly add the 2 mL of Wnt antagonism-based chondrogenic medium along the tube wall to prevent disturbing the pellet.
Maintenance/medium refreshment
Timing: 10–20 days
Refresh the differentiation medium.
Refresh the Wnt antagonism-based chondrogenic medium.
Carefully remove the liquid from the centrifuge tube and avoid aspirating the MSC pellet.
Slowly add 2 mL of Wnt antagonism-based chondrogenic medium along the tube wall to prevent disturbing the pellet.
Maintained in culture for 10–20 days. Refresh the medium every 2–3 days.
Note: 20-day induction can induce more glycosaminoglycans production, but a 10-day induction is sufficient to induce a significant rapid chondrogenesis compared to traditional TGF-β-based method.
Characterization
Timing: 2 days
Characterization of MSC chondrogenic differentiation by chondrogenic gene expression and Alcian blue staining (stain glycosaminoglycans in extracellular matrix of chondrocytes).
Examination of chondrogenic genes by quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR).1[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib1],7[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib7]

Extract total RNA from pellets and reverse transcript to cDNA following the operation manual provided by manufacturer.
Perform qPCR with primers of chondrogenic marker genes below:

Note: Chondrogenic gene expression can be analyzed at any time point of interest during differentiation process.
Alcian blue staining.8[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib8],9[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib9]
Staining of the whole pellet.
Wash sample pellet with PBS.
Fix samples with 0.5 mL 4% paraformaldehyde for 10 min at 25°C.
Wash with PBS, rinse in 0.1 N HCl for 5 min.
Stain the samples with 0.5 mL Alcian blue solution (pH 1.0) for 1 h.
Wash with 0.5 mL 0.1 N HCl for 5 min. Repeat this step until the solution is colorless.
Rinse with ddH2O.
Transfer the pellets to a 24-well plate and conduct microscopic imaging with bright field at 40x magnification.
Quantification of Alcian blue staining (elusion).9[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib9],10[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib10]
Wash the pellets with PBS for 5 min, transfer to PCR tube then remove supernatant.
Digest the pellets with 5 μL collagenase I (3 mg/mL in PBS) at 37°C for 3 h.
Carefully aspire the supernatant.
Dissolve the pellets with 20 μL of 6 M Guanidine HCl by rigorous pipetting.
Supernatant was transferred to transparent 96-well plate (for absorbance analysis).
Add 30 μL of ddH2O (total 50 μL) each well and measure the absorbance at 650 nm (Dilution could be applied if necessary).
Staining of sliced pellet.
Wash sample pellet with PBS.
Fix samples with 4% paraformaldehyde for 10 min at 25°C.
Embed the MSC pellet in OCT compound and freeze at ‒80°C.
Pause point: The sample can be stored at ‒80°C for at least several months.
Cut the pellet into 10 μm sections using a cryostat and place the sections onto microscope slides.
Rehydrate the sections by washing them with distilled water three times for 2 min each.

Rinse in 0.1 N HCl for 5 min.
Stain the sections with Alcian blue solution (pH 1.0) for 30 min.
Wash with 0.1 N HCl for 5 min.
Rinse with ddH2O.
Dehydrate the sections by dipping them into graded alcohol solutions (70%, 95%, and 100% ethanol) for 2 min each.
Clear the sections with xylene for 2 min.
Mount the slides with cover slips using mounting medium.
Microscopic imaging.
